channel.title: Linux User Help
channel.description: I have the operating system Linux, with Ubuntu and firefox internet. I am not sure how to use linux, and most of the servers I try to play either don't work or they are very glitchy. If anyone can help me, please do.

item.title: Linux User Help
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

nkindel2:

even some of the most advanced servers dont work, like thats just for web clients, i cant even try to run actual clients, and on moparscape idk any good serv ip’s but it works, and some of moparscapes highest voted servers on status page dont work, it sais the error thing, and it sais to try again to like reboot computer, i heard of being able to download windows instead of ubuntu, can someone explain that to me?

If moparscape runs, then Java is configured correctly. You just have to find an IP to connect to with it, or pester other people who run ‘web clients’ to not be idiots and keep them cross-platform.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux User Help
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

nkindel2:

even some of the most advanced servers dont work, like thats just for web clients, i cant even try to run actual clients, and on moparscape idk any good serv ip’s but it works, and some of moparscapes highest voted servers on status page dont work, it sais the error thing, and it sais to try again to like reboot computer, i heard of being able to download windows instead of ubuntu, can someone explain that to me?

If you’re using the moparscape client, what errors do you get in the console? Surely there are some? Why can’t you get actual clients to run? What does the terminal print?

Read full topic

item.title: Linux User Help
item.dc:creator: @R_A_R_E_S R A R E S
item.description:
@R_A_R_E_S wrote:

Moparisthebest:

It’s not ‘trickier’ at all, in fact stuff should ‘just work’. Does the moparscape client work? If so, everything is set up correctly. The reason some other clients might not work is because the programmer has no idea what they are doing and hard coded in paths like ‘C:/bla/bla’, you can’t do anything about this and will just need to play with a client that does work, like moparscape.

Idk i think that linux is weirder to me than xp :[ sorry for the intimidating info

Read full topic

The reason some other clients might not work is because the programmer has no idea what they are doing and hard coded in paths like ‘C:/bla/bla’, you can’t do anything about this and will just need to play with a client that does work, like moparscape.
